name: Homemade Chili Oil
description: Chili oil, the quintessential Chinese condiment â€” the perfect accompaniment of any pancake, bun, dumpling, noodles, or porridge.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup vegetable oil (or other neutral oil)
1/3 cup Chinese red chili flakes (substitute: gochugaru)
1/2 teaspoon Chinese black vinegar (substitute: rice vinegar)

recipeInstructions.name: In a heat-safe bowl, combine star anise, bay leaf, cassia bark (or cinnamon stick), white sesame seeds, red chili flakes, five-spice, ground Sichuan pepper, salt, msg (if adding), and Chinese black vinegar.
recipeInstructions.text: In a heat-safe bowl, combine star anise, bay leaf, cassia bark (or cinnamon stick), white sesame seeds, red chili flakes, five-spice, ground Sichuan pepper, salt, msg (if adding), and Chinese black vinegar.

recipeInstructions.name: Heat vegetable oil on medium heat along with the whole peeled ginger as well as crushed garlic, left in their pods. When the ginger and the garlic both turn golden-brown, fish them out of the oil and immediately pour oil into the prepared heat-safe bowl. Note: The oil should not be too hot, otherwise you will end up with burnt chili flakes. Shoot for 200-250 F. Be careful as the oil will sizzle as soon as it hits the spices.

recipeInstructions.name: Let the chili oil cool completely before transferring into a mason jar, or other air-tight glass container. Store in refrigerator.
